title: It’s time
text: Would definitely go back. Lots of interesting choices on the menu... lots. My meal was great; so was my date’s. And the portions were large. Our drinks were good, the chips and salsa were good, our server was friendly and quick, and the place has a nice atmosphere. I liked this place quite a bit.

title: a relaxing evening
text: The tavern is old but well maintained. There are several seating ares and arrangements. The quality of the food is very good. You will leave full.

title: A great playground for kids
text: An unbelievable structure and full of many activities. The three story tube slide is a must if you can get thru the maze.

title: Pizza a different way
text: There is a large variety of pizzas. I like most of them. The pizza with fruit is just not for me. it is worth a stop.

title: Where have I been all this time?
text: The restaurant is mid size. The service was attentive. The food was plentiful. The price a bit above average but the quality above average. Drive past the restaurant several days a week but never went in. Will not hesitate to stop and dine again in the future

title: Very disappointing
text: Flight staff was aloof and gave us misinformation concerning customs. The airport was chaos. Food on the plane was actually pretty good.

title: The mosaic architecture is astonding
text: There are frescoes in the garden. The garden is outlined by gorgeous mosaic columns and benches. The museum inside is also worth a look.

title: Immpressive
text: This museum has a collection that dates back several thousand years. The displays explain the ancient history of Crete starting with the Minoans. A walk down history lane.

title: An ancient marvel
text: If you want to see an actual aqueduct up close this is the stop. Nothing else to see or read about just a photo op.

title: Oldie but Goodie
text: This is a nice walk around piece of history. There is plenty of room to walk and rest and learn. There is a video which explains the history. The scenery is also beautiful.

title: A spiritual experience
text: To be baptized again was one of the parts of our trip that we were anticipating. The site is well run, very organized. You can rent a robe and get changed and submerge yourself in the Jordan river.
place: The Baptism Site Of Jesus Christ

title: Close to the Basilica
text: You are on the same grounds of the Basilica so it is worth a stop. Nothing awe inspiring but not every church is.

title: Well done
text: The mosaics from countries around the world are impressive. Make this one of your stops in Nazareth. It is worth it.

title: Use your time somewhere else
text: If it is important for you to know you were in Bethlehem, then of course go. The church is a ten minute walk up a crowded city street and not much to see when you get there.

title: Nothing but vendors
text: The via is over crowded. People going in all directions. A sign indicating the name of the via and a sign indicating a station of the cross. Thought it would be one of my highlights but it was not. Happy to get out of there.
place: The Way of the Cross - Via Dolorosa

title: Crowded but worthwhile
text: Although a bit crowded there is room to observe the different parts of the Church. A stop I would recommend

title: Stop for a minute
text: Do not go out of your way to visit. The mount affords a very nice view of the city. The Biblical significance is the attraction. Nothing else to see,

title: A time of solace
text: The area is big enough and has room enough for you to reflect. You are not rushed or hustled. It is your time to contemplate and be at a peace.

title: Inspiring
text: The wailing wall is the best area and also the Holy Sepulcher church. The rest of the city is a series of over crowded alleyways full of "tourist" shops.

title: Go see other sights
text: If you are Christian you want to say you were at the garden. It is a line of people walking past the garden (very small - you stay along a path outside the garden) thru a small church and out the exit. The end.

title: Well done
text: There is too much to see in one visit. Time is needed to read and understand the displays. A museum to learn from.

title: A nice stroll
text: Enjoyed walking thru the old town. The palace of the grand masters is a must. Good views all around.

title: Photo ops only
text:
The famous windmills are nothing more than an opportunity to take picture.

The view of the sea is beautiful as well as a quaint nice village to stroll thru and relax

title: Beer and lunch
text:
A short stroll from the parthenon and across from the museum. A little hard to find but worth the effort.

Beer and pizza hit the spot. Average food but at a very good price. Service very attentive.

title: Food vs decor
text:
Food was excellent and plentiful. We ordered the mix platter for two. It had kabobs, pita bread, beef, lamb and pork. Enough food for easily three hungry people.

The decor is old used furniture.

Price very reasonable.

title: Pleasant stroll
text:
The area is pedestrian friendly ( no cars) and has many shops to browse thru. The area is a convenient walk to the parthenon.

Good area to relax and have a meal.

title: Costly but good value
text:
The buffet breakfast is excellent. The food and drinks in the lounge excellent. The cost expensive.

The hotel caters to businessmen and travel companies. It is a long walk or a short taxi ride to the downtown area.

title: Well done!
text:
The advanced planning that went into the design is obvious. Whether you go before or after your trip to the parthenon, this is a required stop.

The signage and video is well done and easy to follow.

The view of the acropolis from the museum is riveting.

title: Cab for hire
text: Took several cabs during our stays. All were excellent and very reasonable. The downtown area is full of taxis so “hailing” one is easy. Most trips 5 euro plus tip.

title: Of course
text:
You can’t go to Athens without going to the parthenon. Get there before 9 o’clock to beat the crowds. Bring a bottle of water, you will need it.

When leaving take the road down the hill to the Plaka district. Touristy but nice to walk around.

title: Diner food as expected
text: The food and ambience were as we expected. It is a diner, a Jersey, diner. Service was good and the price was fair. The deep fried scrapple was perfect. We left full!

title: Nostalgia
text:
The ambience is the draw. Memories from the 50’s and decorated in the period.

Food (hamburgers, hotdogs, ice cream sundaes, etc.) was average and not as filling as it should have been. Milkshakes were not very thick.

title: Thin is in
text:
We went here several times during the week. The pizza has very thin crust which we enjoy. Crust not chewy! The warm, made fresh
, waffle and ice cream is a must.

title: Worth checking out
text: We had lunch. The food was very good and enough to satisfy our hunger. The price was reasonable. Had the cheese steak.

title: Sleep but don't eat
text:
The room was wonderful - large. The hotel perfectly located to St Michaels and other destinations.

The breakfast was below Holiday Express standards. I tried the eggs, pancakes, muffins, oatmeal. It was all warm, dry, etc.

I did like the little "doggie" bags for those that were going site-seeing to take some fruit, etc. for the trip.

title: Great for kids
text: Walk along the many small boats bringing in their catch of the day. The lighthouse was educational. Learn why they don't drive the pilings into the soft beach to support the structures as many other coastal towns do. They have a better method.

title: anchors aweigh
text:
The cruise is for relaxing not much in the way of educational.

The speaker system was very good and it was easy to walk around the boat for good views.

title: Accommodating to all
text: Very clean and well organized. Plenty of info to read and plan your trip. Restrooms very clean. A good rest stop.
place: Visitor Center at Sailwinds Park East

title: our destination
text:
We had not cracked crabs on paper tablecloths for thirty years. We decided to drive down and take a crack at it again.

The crabs were a bit dry - could not get any juice out of the small legs and the side dishes were $ 5 - not a good value.

title: A place to meet
text:
Just like the “Cheers Bar” everybody knows everybody. Food is very good and filling.

Service was top notch. Two full breakfasts with tip $ 20.

Phillies decorations around the restaurant.
